Yes, but I need something that is *machine readable* so that no human inter=
vention is needed to check which methods are already implemented in each un=
iversity.

I could implement my own XML schema for this, but I'm trying to =
find some kind of standard in the "REST realm".

Thanks anyway,
S=E9rgio Nu=
nes

> You already have it below ((1) and (2)).
> 
> ----- Original Message=
 ----- 
> From: "Sergio Nunes" <ssn@...>
> To: <rest-discuss@yahoogr=
oups.com>
> Sent: Saturday, January 03, 2004 1:49 PM
> Subject: [rest-discu=
ss] Help on defining a web services framework
> 
> 
> Hi,
> 
> I'm working =
on a framework for student information sharing between
> universities using=
 a REST architecture. Imagine two interfaces that
> the universities *may* =
implement:
> 
> (1) http://university.edu/ws/list - returns a list of links=
 to each student.
> (2) http://university.edu/ws/search - accepts a keyword=
 and returns a list
> of links to each student that contains 'keyword' in i=
t's name.
> 
> Sample response:
> 
> <students>
>   <student link=3D"http:/=
/university.edu/ws/student/001"/>
>   <student link=3D"http://university.ed=
u/ws/student/002"/>
>   <student link=3D"http://university.edu/ws/student/0=
03"/>
> </students>
> 
> Since each university might implement neither, one=
 or both interfaces,
> I would like to define a way for each university to =
"say" which
> interfaces they implement... something like WSDL, that would =
allow
> automatic service discovery among universities.
> 
> Is there any s=
tandard way of doing this within the REST arch. style?
> 
> Thanks in advan=
ce.
> Best regards,
> S=E9rgio Nunes
